member.name: T:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics
member.summary: Statistics operating on an array already sorted ascendingly.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.Minimum(System.Double[])
member.summary: Returns the smallest value from the sorted data array (ascending).
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.Maximum(System.Double[])
member.summary: Returns the largest value from the sorted data array (ascending).
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.OrderStatistic(System.Double[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the order statistic (order 1..N) from the sorted data array (ascending).
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.
One-based order of the statistic, must be between 1 and N (inclusive).

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.Median(System.Double[])
member.summary: Estimates the median value from the sorted data array (ascending). Approximately median-unbiased regardless of the sample distribution (R8).
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.Percentile(System.Double[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Estimates the p-Percentile value from the sorted data array (ascending). If a non-integer Percentile is needed, use Quantile instead. Approximately median-unbiased regardless of the sample distribution (R8).
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.
Percentile selector, between 0 and 100 (inclusive).

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.LowerQuartile(System.Double[])
member.summary: Estimates the first quartile value from the sorted data array (ascending). Approximately median-unbiased regardless of the sample distribution (R8).
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.UpperQuartile(System.Double[])
member.summary: Estimates the third quartile value from the sorted data array (ascending). Approximately median-unbiased regardless of the sample distribution (R8).
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.InterquartileRange(System.Double[])
member.summary: Estimates the inter-quartile range from the sorted data array (ascending). Approximately median-unbiased regardless of the sample distribution (R8).
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.FiveNumberSummary(System.Double[])
member.summary: Estimates {min, lower-quantile, median, upper-quantile, max} from the sorted data array (ascending). Approximately median-unbiased regardless of the sample distribution (R8).
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.Quantile(System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Estimates the tau-th quantile from the sorted data array (ascending). The tau-th quantile is the data value where the cumulative distribution function crosses tau. Approximately median-unbiased regardless of the sample distribution (R8).
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.
Quantile selector, between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive).
member.remarks: R-8, SciPy-(1/3,1/3): Linear interpolation of the approximate medians for order statistics. When tau < (2/3) / (N + 1/3), use x1. When tau >= (N - 1/3) / (N + 1/3), use xN.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.QuantileCustom(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Estimates the tau-th quantile from the sorted data array (ascending). The tau-th quantile is the data value where the cumulative distribution function crosses tau. The quantile definition can be specified by 4 parameters a, b, c and d, consistent with Mathematica.
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.
Quantile selector, between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive).
a-parameter
b-parameter
c-parameter
d-parameter

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.QuantileCustom(System.Double[],System.Double,MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.QuantileDefinition)
member.summary: Estimates the tau-th quantile from the sorted data array (ascending). The tau-th quantile is the data value where the cumulative distribution function crosses tau. The quantile definition can be specified to be compatible with an existing system.
member.param: Sample array, must be sorted ascendingly.
Quantile selector, between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive).
Quantile definition, to choose what product/definition it should be consistent with

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.EmpiricalCDF(System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Estimates the empirical cumulative distribution function (CDF) at x from the sorted data array (ascending).
member.param: The data sample sequence.
The value where to estimate the CDF at.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.QuantileRank(System.Double[],System.Double,MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.RankDefinition)
member.summary: Estimates the quantile tau from the sorted data array (ascending). The tau-th quantile is the data value where the cumulative distribution function crosses tau. The quantile definition can be specified to be compatible with an existing system.
member.param: The data sample sequence.
Quantile value.
Rank definition, to choose how ties should be handled and what product/definition it should be consistent with

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.SortedArrayStatistics.Ranks(System.Double[],MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.RankDefinition)
member.summary: Evaluates the rank of each entry of the sorted data array (ascending). The rank definition can be specified to be compatible with an existing system.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.StreamingStatistics.Variance(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Estimates the unbiased population variance from the provided samples as enumerable sequence, in a single pass without memoization. On a dataset of size N will use an N-1 normalizer (Bessel's correction). Returns NaN if data has less than two entries or if any entry is NaN.
member.param: Sample stream, no sorting is assumed.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.StreamingStatistics.Variance(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Single})
member.summary: Estimates the unbiased population variance from the provided samples as enumerable sequence, in a single pass without memoization. On a dataset of size N will use an N-1 normalizer (Bessel's correction). Returns NaN if data has less than two entries or if any entry is NaN.
member.param: Sample stream, no sorting is assumed.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.StreamingStatistics.PopulationVariance(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Evaluates the population variance from the full population provided as enumerable sequence, in a single pass without memoization. On a dataset of size N will use an N normalizer and would thus be biased if applied to a subset. Returns NaN if data is empty or if any entry is NaN.
member.param: Sample stream, no sorting is assumed.

member.name: T:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.WeightedDescriptiveStatistics
member.summary: Computes the basic statistics of data set. The class meets the NIST standard of accuracy for mean, variance, and standard deviation (the only statistics they provide exact values for) and exceeds them in increased accuracy mode. Recommendation: consider to use RunningWeightedStatistics instead.
member.remarks: This type declares a DataContract for out of the box ephemeral serialization with engines like DataContractSerializer, Protocol Buffers and FsPickler, but does not guarantee any compatibility between versions. It is not recommended to rely on this mechanism for durable persistence.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Statistics.WeightedDescriptiveStatistics.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Tuple{System.Double,System.Double}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The sample data.
If set to true, increased accuracy mode used. Increased accuracy mode uses types for internal calculations.
member.remarks: Don't use increased accuracy for data sets containing large values (in absolute value). This may cause the calculations to overflow.
